column3: Nice find, dunno how I missed that, should have been the first thing I checked rather than assuming it was a Qt quirk.\n\nThe fix works for me. It also needs to be added into the `Debug` configuration block 10 lines or so below.

> The fix works for me. It also needs to be added into the `Debug` configuration block 10 lines or so below.

It is intentional:

> It is still possible to use the `-printtoconsole` option for debug builds.

~~If ["`WINDOWS` is the default"](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/reference/subsystem-specify-subsystem?view=msvc-160#arguments), why do we need to set this? What subsystem do we end up using currently?~~\n\nAh I see, `CONSOLE` is actually the default, unless `WinMain` or `wWinMain` is defined.

> Ah I see, `CONSOLE` is actually the default, unless `WinMain` or `wWinMain` is defined.

It's also set to `CONSOLE` in the `common.init.vcxproj` file and needs to be overridden.
